intro: Sabazia urticifolia, commonly known as the stinging nettle plant, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy, often stinging leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in spherical inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its common name refers to the irritant hairs on its leaves, which can cause skin irritation upon contact.
